summary:
Dr. Mark van Staalduinen — his ambition lies in the prevention and disruption of criminal activities abusing innovations in cyberspace and new technologies, specifically Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain and IoT. He drives cybersecurity beyond the state of the art through strategic and technological solutions. First, strategic studies and roadmap or platform development to articulate specific challenges and identify practical solutions. Technical solutions targets translational research and development into specific solutions from operational analytics and data-driven proof of concepts into practical, sustainable and global solutions. To achieve these goals, he focuses on human capital development and academic collaborations for capacity building as the key enabler. 

He received his MSc (2003) and PhD (2010) degrees from Delft University of Technology (DUT) in Electrical Engineering at the Department of Information and Communication Theory. Dr. van Staalduinen worked at The Netherlands Organisation for applied scientific research (TNO) between 2007 and 2019 as a consultant and innovation manager focussed on cybercrime and national security. From January 2016 to December 2019, Dr. van Staalduinen has a position for TNO in Singapore to strengthen international cooperation and partnerships in Southeast Asia, including secondment as a cybercrime expert at INTERPOL Global Complex for Innovation. Since January 2020, he has been Managing Director of CFLW Cyber Strategies and operates from the Netherlands, and has a part-time position at Nanyang Technological University of Singapore (NTU).

Competences
- Multi-stakeholder collaborations
- DeepTech entrepreneur
- Innovation management
- Organization sensitive
- Speaker

publications.name: Towards a Comprehensive Insight into the Thematic Organization of the Tor Hidden Services
publications.publisher: To appear in: Proceedings of IEEE Joint Intelligence and Security Informatics Conference (JISIC), The Hague.

profile_positions.description:
Propelled by our ambition to disrupt criminal activities that abuse cyberspace and emergent technologies, CFLW provides solutions at the intersection of strategy and technology to stay secure in the digital transformation and to navigate through the cyber-physical convergence. With our projects and services, we provide to our network of trusted partners key solutions in the following areas:

-          Disrupting Dark Web and Virtual Asset abuse 
-          Strengthening Cybersecurity in Emergent Technologies 
-          Advancing Human Capital by Research and Development 

CFLW offers unique solutions based on our operational experience in the international security community, deep knowledge of new technologies and user-centred co-creation strategy. At CFLW, our solutions rethink your cyber threats through the eyes of the adversary.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director and Founder

profile_positions.description:
Trust and safety refers to the expectation that digital technologies and services – and the organizations that provide them – protect the interests of all and uphold societal expectations and values. New decentralized technologies such as blockchain, multiparty computing, homomorphic encryption and federated learning offer opportunities and challenges to our societies. The Trust and Safety theme of Dutch Blockchain Coalition develops an acceleration program for two pillars:
1) Security measures against abuse and fraud in crypto-assets and blockchain
2) Trust technologies for a safe and reliable digital society
profile_positions.title: Trust and Safety Lead

profile_positions.description: Support the Cyberspace and New Technologies Lab of INTERPOL's Innovation Centre with expertise, concept development and solution testing to combat criminal innovations in the areas of Dark Web, IoT, 5G and Cyber-enabled Financial Crimes.
profile_positions.title: Specialist Consultant to Cyberspace and New Technologies

profile_positions.description: Empowering the Cyberspace and New Technologies Lab with roadmapping, platform development and solution testing to combat criminal innovations abusing new technologies as Dark Web, Blockchain and IoT. The Innovation Centre is located within the INTERPOL Global Complex for Innovation in Singapore.
profile_positions.title: Seconded Cybercrime Expert

profile_positions.description: Country Director to the Netherlands and Germany at the Nanyang Technopreneurship Centre (NTC) of the Nanyang Technological University (NTU) of Singapore. In this capacity supporting collaborations between Singapore and the Netherlands and Germany with special attention for talent scouting and entrepreneurship development.
profile_positions.title: Country Director the Netherlands and Germany

profile_positions.description: By January 2021 CyberDevOps activities are transfered to CFLW Cyber Development, and CyberDevOps proceeds as joint venture of Manifera Pte Ltd and CFLW Cyber Strategies.
profile_positions.title: Director and Co-founder

profile_positions.description: Committed to drive cybersecurity beyond the state of the art by roadmapping, platform development and experimentation in international security networks to identify solutions to combat cybercrime and cyberterrorism. Given the global extent of cyberspace and new technologies, the complexity of cyber security innovation requires international collaboration: for example, with Law Enforcement Agencies as INTERPOL (IGCI) and Europol (EC3), Financial institutes and Security organisations/industry. Together with our team of experts and network with excellent research partners, proof of concepts are developed to test new solutions in order to accelerate and counter the pace of criminal innovations.
profile_positions.title: Innovation Manager

profile_positions.description: Develop, grow and strengthen our TNO Research Office in Singapore.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Director TNO Singapore

profile_positions.description:
Develop new security concepts to make our highly connected societies more secure. In close cooperation with various partners. Result: concrete and practical solutions.

I am fascinated by internet, living in a free world and innovation. The internet, combined with all inspiring mobile devices, has changed our world drastically. It brings us many good things. On the other hand, we face challenges that threat our freedom. What about the bad, cyber-driven crimes within Dark Markets or in general on the Dark Web. Or the ugly, like online extremism or terrorism on a diversity of domains on the internet. 

To make our societies more secure, we are doing the following. First, we develop deep understanding of specific phenomena. We live in a big data era, so nearly all information is available in open sources. Challenge is to discover, aggregate and filter data towards actionable intelligence. Second, these items can be of value at strategic, tactical or operational levels. In cooperation with our partners we experiment with big data concepts, close to practice, to experience the added value. Third, in case of successful experiments we support the implementation of the concept within the partner organization(s), mainly by supporting quality assurance.
profile_positions.title: Innovation Consultant

profile_positions.description: Within our department multimedia technologies I make connections between high-level knowledge about media mining technology and its application for our partners. Media mining is a collection of technologies that automatically generate meta-data or create structure in large amounts of multimedia content so that content is available at the right time. Relevant markets are, for example, the media sector with large amounts appealing audiovisual or intelligent workplaces where technology supports the worker in his working process.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description: Within the department Information and Communication Theory at Delft University of Technology I finished my PhD research. The subject was the automatic search and discovery of paper used in the time of Rembrandt van Rhijn. This is relevant because pieces of paper with identical paper structures are used in the same period. This logic can be declared as following. Pieces of paper are equal to each other if they are produced using the same scoop sieve. The identity is determined by patterns that are recognized in the paper, which have their origin in the sieve. Consider for example a watermark, but actually more important chain and water lines. The solutions described in my thesis. These line characteristics are detected in X-ray images of the paper so that similar pieces of paper can be found quickly using an optimized data representation.
profile_positions.title: Phd Researcher

profile_positions.description: Go West was an Internet company. Initially focussing on developing websites. Since these were becoming more sophisticated, the developed knowledge was applied to develop a product: Go-West Web Statistics.
profile_positions.title: Director and Owner
